It's dead, and when I call it again, hopefully it can be reactivated

For example
```powershell
PS > Copy-Item -Path "xxx" -Destination "xxx" -Recurse -Force -FromSession (Get-PSSession -id 17)
```
```powershell
Invoke-Command -ScriptBlock {} -Session $s
```

comments.author: he852100
comments.body:
### When using Enter-PSSession
**Results**
```powershell
[administrator@[0::0]]: PS > get-acl
Command 'get-acl' was not run as the session in which it was intended to run was either closed or broken
PS />
```
----
**Expected**
```powershell
[administrator@[0::0]]: PS > get-acl
Connection disconnected,Trying to reconnect
Directory: C:\Users\Administrator
Path      Owner                  Access
----      -----                  ------
Documents BUILTIN\Administrators NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM Allow  Fu…
[administrator@[0::0]]: PS >
```
or
```powershell
[administrator@[0::0]]: PS > get-acl
Connection disconnected,Whether to reconnect[y/n]? y
Directory: C:\Users\Administrator
Path      Owner                  Access
----      -----                  ------ 
Documents BUILTIN\Administrators NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM Allow  Fu…
[administrator@[0::0]]: PS >
```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: I don't think it can reconnect if the server side has been cleaned up or if credentials are required they aren't stored in the pssession.  However, I can see how it would be more user friendly to try to establish a new connection but the user would need to understand that the remote state is probably gone.

comments.author: he852100
comments.body:
In two cases

1. The credentials have been stored. It exists. We'll just call him again
```powershell
$s=Get-Credential
New-PSSession * -Credential $s
enter-PSSession * -Credential $s
enter-PSSession * -UserName $s
```
or
```powershell
New-PSSession * KeyFilePath *
enter-PSSession * KeyFilePath *
```

2. The credentials are not stored
```powershell
New-PSSession * -Credential a
New-PSSession * -UserName r
enter-PSSession * -Credential a
enter-PSSession * -UserName r
```
When he reconnects again, we'll just enter the password.
```powershell
[administrator@[0::0]]: PS > get-acl
Connection disconnected,Whether to reconnect[y/n]? y
password:
Directory: C:\Users\Administrator
Path      Owner                  Access
----      -----                  ------ 
Documents BUILTIN\Administrators NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM Allow  Fu…
[administrator@[0::0]]: PS >
```
